title: Static Webpage
description: Learn how to create a basic static webpage using HTML, CSS, and a little bit of JavaScript.

steps.title: Step 1: Setting Up
steps.description: Create a new folder for your project. Inside this folder, create three files: index.html, styles.css, and script.js. These files will contain the structure, styling, and functionality of our webpage, respectively.

steps.title: Step 2: HTML Structure
steps.description: Open the index.html file and write the basic structure of an HTML document. Include tags for the doctype, html, head, title, and body.
steps.codeSnippet:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Static Webpage</title>
    <link rel='stylesheet' type='text/css' href='styles.css'>
</head>
<body>
    <!-- Your content here -->
    <script src='script.js'></script>
</body>
</html>

steps.title: Step 3: Adding Content
steps.description: Inside the body tag of your HTML file, add some content for your webpage. This could include headings, paragraphs, images, or anything else you want to display.
steps.codeSnippet:
Welcome to My Static Webpage!

This is a basic introduction to web development using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

steps.title: Step 4: Styling with CSS
steps.description: Open the styles.css file and add styles to make your webpage visually appealing. You can change colors, fonts, margins, and more.

steps.title: Step 5: Adding Interactivity
steps.description: If you want to add some interactivity to your webpage, open the script.js file and write JavaScript code. This could include event listeners, animations, or other interactive features.
